timeline.title: Our Journey
timeline.subtitle: From a student forum to a worldwide open-source education resource

2019.title: EnterMedSchool is Born
2019.description: Ari Horesh creates EnterMedSchool as a forum for IMAT exam students to help each other study and share resources.

2020.title: Free Content Begins
2020.description: Ari starts releasing free educational content, collaborating with OpenStax materials to provide quality open-source resources.

2021.title: Leading IMAT Course
2021.description: Launch of paid IMAT courses, becoming the world's leading IMAT preparation course. Revenue funds the creation of free resources.

2025.title: New Generation
2025.description: Connecting with professors and doctors worldwide to verify and create content, releasing everything for free.

2026.title: Open Source Goes Official
2026.description: Launch of EnterMedSchool.org ‚Äî a free resource archive for medical educators. Anki addon, Chrome extension, and hundreds of open-source resources.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.quote: We believe the resources and tools educators need to teach well should be free and open source.
mission.description: EnterMedSchool.org is a resource archive for medical educators. Everything here is free to download, embed on your website, and share with your students. Just remember to attribute.
mission.relationship: EnterMedSchool.com funds this project through paid courses and services. Everything here on .org is free, open-source, and always will be. Download, embed, and use anything you find for your classroom.

cta.title: Everything here is free. Just give credit.
cta.subtitle: Download resources for your slides, embed tools on your website, or share directly with your students. All we ask is that you attribute.

about.title: About EnterMedSchool
about.metaDescription: Discover EnterMedSchool ‚Äî a free, open-source platform providing medical education tools, visual lessons, and teaching resources for educators worldwide. Non-profit since 2019.

hero.annotation: from one project to many educators!

story.title: Our Story
story.content: EnterMedSchool was created in 2019 by Ari Horesh as a simple forum where IMAT exam students could help each other. What started as a community project grew into the world's leading IMAT preparation platform, and now, an open-source resource archive for medical educators worldwide.

orgMission.title: Why .org?
orgMission.content: The goal of EnterMedSchool.com was always to fund this project. The paid courses and services on our main site enable us to create and maintain free, open-source resources for medical educators worldwide. EnterMedSchool.org is where that mission lives ‚Äî a free archive of tools, visuals, textbooks, and guides that you can download, embed, and share with your students.

values.title: What We Believe
values.openSourceDesc: All our resources are free to download, embed, and share for non-commercial educational use.
values.teachingDesc: Every resource is designed to be used in your lectures, on your website, or shared with your students.
values.worldwideDesc: Medical educators everywhere deserve access to quality teaching resources.
values.collaborationDesc: We work with professors and doctors worldwide to verify and create content.

latexEditor.title: LaTeX Editor
latexEditor.metaTitle: LaTeX Editor ‚Äî Free Online LaTeX for Educators | EnterMedSchool
latexEditor.metaDescription: Write and edit LaTeX for your handouts, papers, and teaching materials. Drag-and-drop snippets, medical templates, and live preview. Free and open-source.
latexEditor.description: Write and edit LaTeX for your handouts and papers. Live preview, drag-and-drop snippets, and medical templates. A free, open-source Overleaf alternative.

ui.templateGallerySubtitle: Choose a template to get started quickly. Every template is designed for medical students.
ui.noTemplatesFound: No templates found matching your search.
ui.previewUnavailableHint: Switch to Code view to see the LaTeX source, or click "Use This Template" to load it into the editor.
ui.snippetsHint: Click Insert to add a snippet. Expand for explanations.
ui.noFavoritesYet: No favorites yet. Click the star on snippets to add them.
ui.starTip: Tip: Star your favorite snippets for quick access
ui.advancedLaTeXSimplified: Some advanced LaTeX features were simplified for the live preview. Your original code will compile perfectly in Overleaf.
ui.envNotSupported: The environment "{name}" isn't supported in the live preview. It will work in Overleaf.
ui.cmdNotSupported: The command \{cmd} isn't supported in the live preview. It will work in Overleaf.
ui.cmdNotSupportedGeneric: A command isn't supported in the live preview, but it will work when you compile in Overleaf.
ui.missingBrace: There seems to be a missing brace { } or bracket [ ]. Check that every opening symbol has a matching closing one.
ui.environmentIssue: An environment (\begin{...}/\end{...}) has an issue. Make sure they match and are properly nested.
ui.previewTip: Tip: The live preview supports basic LaTeX. Advanced packages and environments will compile correctly when you export to Overleaf (click Export in the toolbar). Your code is fine!
ui.goToLineTitle: Click to go to this line in the editor
ui.fixBeginEnd: Make sure every \begin{...} has a matching \end{...}
ui.fixEscape: Escape special characters: use \% not %, \& not &, \_ not _
ui.tourWelcomeDesc: LaTeX is a tool used by scientists and researchers worldwide to create beautifully formatted documents ‚Äî thesis papers, research articles, presentations, and more. Don't worry if you've never used LaTeX ‚Äî we'll guide you step by step!
ui.tourEditorDesc: This is where you write LaTeX code. It may look like programming, but it's simpler than you think! Each command starts with a backslash (\) and tells LaTeX how to format your text. The editor highlights different parts in colors to help you read the code.
ui.tourPreviewDesc: As you type in the editor, your document is rendered in real-time here so you can immediately see how it looks. It's like having a Word document update live while you write the code!
ui.tourToolbarDesc: Use these buttons to format your text ‚Äî just like Word! Select text in the editor first, then click Bold, Italic, or any other button. You can also insert sections, lists, tables, and equations.
ui.tourToolbarTask: Try clicking the Bold button below!
ui.tourSnippetsDesc: Don't know how to write a table, equation, or list? The Snippets panel has ready-made LaTeX code blocks you can click to insert. Each snippet comes with a plain-English explanation.
ui.tourSnippetsTask: Click the Snippets button to open the panel!
ui.tourTemplatesDesc: Start from a template! We have templates for lecture notes, lab reports, research papers, thesis chapters, CVs, and more ‚Äî all designed for medical students. Just pick one and customize it.
ui.tourLearnDesc: Open the Learn panel for step-by-step lessons on LaTeX basics. From 'What is LaTeX?' to formatting equations and managing references ‚Äî everything is explained in plain English.
ui.tourExportDesc: When you're done, download your .tex file, copy it to clipboard, or open it directly in Overleaf (a free online LaTeX compiler) for the final PDF. Your work is also automatically saved in your browser.
ui.exportSubtitle: Download your LaTeX source or open it in Overleaf.
ui.downloadTexDesc: Download the raw LaTeX source file. Open it in any LaTeX editor.
ui.downloadZipDesc: All files bundled into a ZIP. Upload directly to Overleaf.
ui.copyToClipboardDesc: Copy the LaTeX source code to paste anywhere.
ui.openInOverleafDesc: Open your document in Overleaf to compile it into a PDF.
ui.exportTip: Tip: For the best PDF output, open your document in Overleaf (free). It compiles LaTeX to professional-quality PDFs.
ui.filesHint: Manage your project files. Click a file to edit it.
ui.equationPlaceholder: Click symbols below or type LaTeX...
ui.equationBuilderTip: Click a symbol to add it to your equation, or click the + button to insert it directly into your document

bmi.title: BMI Calculator
bmi.metaTitle: BMI Calculator ‚Äî Free, Embeddable Body Mass Index Tool | EnterMedSchool
bmi.metaDescription: A free BMI calculator you can embed on your website or use in your lectures. Clinical interpretation, WHO classification, and educational content included.
bmi.description: A BMI calculator with clinical interpretation and WHO classification. Embed on your website or use in your lectures.

labels.bmiPrimeDesc: Ratio of your BMI to the upper limit of normal (25). Values below 1.0 are within the healthy range.
labels.ponderalIndexDesc: A measure that adjusts for height better than BMI. Normal range: 11‚Äì15 kg/m¬≥.
labels.waistGuidanceDesc: BMI alone does not capture abdominal fat distribution. Measure your waist circumference for a more complete risk picture.
labels.waistMaleRisk: Men: Increased risk above 94 cm (37 in) ‚Äî High risk above 102 cm (40 in)
labels.waistFemaleRisk: Women: Increased risk above 80 cm (31.5 in) ‚Äî High risk above 88 cm (34.6 in)
labels.ageContextDesc: BMI thresholds are designed for adults aged 20+. Interpretation may vary with age, sex, muscle mass, and ethnicity.
labels.ageContextUnder20: For individuals under 20, BMI is interpreted using age- and sex-specific percentile charts (CDC or WHO). The standard adult BMI categories shown above may not apply.
labels.healthyRange: For your height, a healthy weight (BMI 18.5‚Äì25) is {min}‚Äì{max} {unit}.
labels.scaleAlt: BMI color scale ranging from underweight through normal to obese categories
labels.validationAge: Age must be between 2 and 120 years.
labels.disclaimer: This calculator is for educational purposes only. It is not a substitute for professional medical judgment. Always consult a healthcare professional for clinical decisions.
labels.weightAbove: You are {value} {unit} above the upper end of the healthy range.
labels.weightBelow: You are {value} {unit} below the lower end of the healthy range.
labels.weightWithin: Your weight is within the healthy range.
labels.emptyStateDesc: Results will appear here automatically as you type.

faq.a1: Body Mass Index (BMI) is a numerical value calculated from a person's weight and height. It is used as a screening tool to categorize individuals into weight status categories such as underweight, normal weight, overweight, and obese. The World Health Organization (WHO) uses BMI as a standard measure for population-level health assessments.
faq.a2: BMI is calculated by dividing a person's weight in kilograms by their height in meters squared (kg/m¬≤). For example, a person weighing 70 kg with a height of 1.75 m would have a BMI of 70 / (1.75 √ó 1.75) = 22.9. In imperial units, you can multiply weight in pounds by 703 and divide by height in inches squared.
faq.q3: What is a healthy BMI range?
faq.a3: According to the WHO, a healthy BMI for adults is between 18.5 and 24.9 kg/m¬≤. A BMI below 18.5 is classified as underweight, 25.0 to 29.9 as overweight, and 30.0 or above as obese. These thresholds are designed for adults aged 20 and older; children and adolescents use age- and sex-specific percentile charts.
faq.q4: What are the limitations of BMI?
faq.a4: BMI does not distinguish between muscle mass, bone density, and fat mass. Athletes or muscular individuals may have a high BMI despite having low body fat. BMI also does not account for fat distribution ‚Äî abdominal fat carries higher health risks than fat stored in other areas. Ethnicity, age, and sex can also influence the relationship between BMI and health risk.
faq.a5: BMI Prime is the ratio of a person's BMI to the upper limit of the healthy range (BMI 25). A BMI Prime of 1.0 means you are at the upper boundary of normal weight. Values below 1.0 indicate you are within or below the healthy range, while values above 1.0 indicate overweight or obesity. It provides a quick, intuitive way to see how far from the healthy threshold you are.

education.aboutBody: Body Mass Index (BMI) is one of the most widely used measures in public health and clinical medicine. Developed by Belgian mathematician Adolphe Quetelet in the 1830s, BMI provides a simple numerical relationship between a person's weight and height. The World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and national health services worldwide use BMI to screen for weight categories that may lead to health problems. While it is not a diagnostic tool on its own, BMI serves as a useful starting point for identifying potential health risks related to body weight.
education.formulaBody: The BMI formula divides a person's body mass (in kilograms) by the square of their height (in meters). This produces a single number expressed in units of kg/m¬≤.
education.formulaExample: For example, a person who weighs 70 kg and is 1.75 m tall has a BMI of 70 / (1.75 √ó 1.75) = 22.9 kg/m¬≤, which falls within the normal weight category. In imperial units, the formula is: weight (lbs) √ó 703 / height (in)¬≤.
education.limitationsBody: While BMI is a convenient screening metric, it has well-documented limitations that clinicians and researchers recognize:
education.limitation1: BMI does not distinguish between lean muscle mass, bone density, and body fat. Athletes and muscular individuals may be classified as overweight or obese despite having low body fat percentages.
education.limitation2: BMI does not account for fat distribution. Visceral (abdominal) fat is strongly associated with cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes, but BMI cannot measure where fat is stored in the body.
education.limitation3: The standard BMI thresholds were developed primarily from data on European populations. Research suggests that health risks associated with a given BMI may vary across different ethnic groups ‚Äî for example, some Asian populations experience elevated risk at lower BMI values.
education.limitation4: BMI is designed for adults aged 20 and older. For children and adolescents, BMI is interpreted using age- and sex-specific percentile charts published by the WHO or CDC, as body composition changes significantly during growth and development.

events.title: Events & Community
events.metaDescription: Join EnterMedSchool community events and meetups for medical students. BBQs, merch drops, networking, and student organization resources ‚Äî all free.

paviaEvent.description: Community BBQ meetup in Pavia for medical students.

events.subtitle: Building healthy medical school communities worldwide.

pavia.title: Student BBQ ‚Äî University of Pavia
pavia.description: Bringing medical students together over food and conversation. Building connections that last beyond the classroom.

merch.title: Free Merch for Medical Students
merch.description: Custom-designed merchandise to build community pride and help students feel part of something bigger.

whatWeOffer.title: How We Help
whatWeOffer.orgsDesc: Help starting and running student organizations at your university.
whatWeOffer.merchDesc: Free advice on designing and printing custom merch for your student group.
whatWeOffer.resourcesDesc: Learn how to set up shared Google Drives, coordinate resource sharing, and build study groups.
whatWeOffer.networkingDesc: Ideas and support for organizing events that bring students together.

philosophy.title: Collaboration Over Competition
philosophy.content: Medical school can sometimes push you to compete with your peers. We believe the best doctors are built through collaboration. We encourage students to help each other, share resources, and build healthy communities.

events.contactCta: Want help organizing events or building community at your university? Get in touch!

license.title: License & Attribution
license.metaDescription: Learn about the EnterMedSchool.org license for free educational resources and generate your attribution badge.

hero.subtitle: Understand how to properly attribute EnterMedSchool materials and generate your badge.

jsonLd.title: License & Attribution
jsonLd.description: License terms and attribution requirements for EnterMedSchool educational resources.

licenseType.title: Non-Commercial Educational Use
licenseType.description: All EnterMedSchool.org resources are licensed for free educational use with proper attribution. No fees, no subscriptions -- just give credit where it's due.

info.title: Our License
info.description: All resources on EnterMedSchool.org are free for non-commercial educational use with proper attribution.

canDo.title: What You CAN Do
items: Download resources for your lectures and slides
Embed tools and visuals on your website

cannotDo.title: What You CANNOT Do
items: Use for commercial purposes without permission
Claim our work as your own

quickStart.title: Get Started in 3 Steps
quickStart.subtitle: Adding attribution is quick and easy. Here's how:

steps.title: Fill In Your Details
steps.description: Enter your name and institution below. We'll save it so you only have to do this once.

steps.title: Download Your Badge
steps.description: Customize the look and download a PNG badge, or copy the HTML embed code.

steps.title: Add to Your Materials
steps.description: Place the badge on your slides, PDFs, or website wherever you use our resources.

generator.title: Attribution Badge Generator
generator.description: Generate a slim attribution badge to include in your slides, PDFs, and materials. Your details are saved in your browser so you won't need to re-enter them.
generator.positionPlaceholder: Department of Medicine, University of Pavia
generator.embedCodeDescription: Paste this HTML into your website, blog, or any platform that supports HTML. Contains dofollow links to EnterMedSchool.

whereToBadge.title: Where to Add Your Badge
whereToBadge.subtitle: Include attribution wherever you use EnterMedSchool resources.

items.title: Presentations & Slides
items.description: Add the badge to your title slide or last slide. Works great in PowerPoint, Google Slides, and Keynote.

items.title: PDFs & Documents
items.description: Place the badge in the footer or on the credits page of your handouts, summaries, or study guides.

items.title: Websites & Blogs
items.description: Use the HTML embed code to add a clean attribution link wherever you publish our content online.

items.title: Printed Materials
items.description: Include the badge image on printed handouts, posters, or any physical educational material.

items.question: Can I use these resources at my university?
items.answer: Yes! All resources are free for educational use at universities, medical schools, and other non-commercial educational institutions. Just include the attribution badge.

items.question: Do I need to pay anything?
items.answer: No. All resources are completely free for non-commercial educational use. There are no fees, subscriptions, or hidden costs.

items.question: What counts as commercial use?
items.answer: Commercial use includes selling our resources, including them in paid courses or materials, or using them to generate revenue. If you're unsure, contact us at ari@entermedschool.com.

items.question: Can I modify the resources for my classes?
items.answer: Absolutely. You can adapt, translate, and modify resources for your teaching needs. Just keep the attribution badge visible and don't remove our branding.

items.question: Do I need approval before using resources?
items.answer: Yes, you must contact ari@entermedschool.com for approval. This helps us track usage and ensure proper attribution. Approval is typically granted quickly for educational use.

items.question: What if I want to use resources commercially?
items.answer: Contact us at ari@entermedschool.com to discuss commercial licensing. We evaluate commercial requests on a case-by-case basis.

contactCta.title: Need Approval or Have Questions?
contactCta.description: Before using our resources, please contact us for approval. We typically respond within 24-48 hours and are happy to help educators.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaDescription: Read EnterMedSchool.org's privacy policy. Learn how we handle cookies, analytics, and protect your data. No tracking, no ads, fully transparent.

hero.subtitle: We respect your privacy. Here is how we handle information on our website.

jsonLd.name: Privacy Policy
jsonLd.description: EnterMedSchool.org privacy policy - how we handle information on our website.

overview.title: Overview
overview.content: EnterMedSchool.org ("we", "us", "our") is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we handle information when you visit our website.

informationWeCollect.title: Information We Collect
informationWeCollect.intro: EnterMedSchool.org is a public, static website. We do not require registration, login, or any personal information to use our resources.

items.email: Email addresses (unless you contact us directly)

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.intro: We use a minimal set of cookies:

essential.label: Essential cookies:
essential.description: A single cookie to store your cookie consent preferences. This is strictly necessary for the website to function.

analytics.label: Analytics cookies (optional):
analytics.description: If you consent, we use Plausible Analytics, a privacy-friendly analytics service that does not use cookies for tracking. Plausible does not collect personal data and is fully GDPR compliant.

cookies.managePreferences: You can manage your cookie preferences at any time using the "Cookie Settings" link in the footer.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.content: With your consent, we use Plausible Analytics to understand aggregate usage patterns. Plausible is privacy-focused and does not track individuals, use cookies for identification, or collect personal data. All data is aggregated and anonymous.

thirdPartyLinks.title: Third-Party Links
thirdPartyLinks.content: Our website may contain links to entermedschool.com and other external sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other sites. We encourage you to review their privacy policies.

childrensPrivacy.title: Children's Privacy
childrensPrivacy.content: Our website is intended for educational use by medical educators. We do not knowingly collect information from children under 13.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated date.

contact.title: Contact
contact.contentBefore: If you have questions about this privacy policy, contact us at

dataController.title: Data Controller
dataController.contentBefore: EnterMedSchool.org is a project by EnterMedSchool. For more information, visit

footer.description: The non-profit, open-source arm of EnterMedSchool ‚Äî free medical education resources for educators to download, embed, and share with their students.

relationship.title: How it works:
relationship.description: EnterMedSchool.com funds this project through its paid courses and services. Everything here on .org is free, open-source, and always will be. Download, embed, and use anything you find ‚Äî just remember to attribute.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.description: The page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.

error.title: Something Went Wrong
error.description: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again ‚Äî if the problem persists, contact us.

toolCode.heroSubtitle: Copy the embed code below to add this tool to your website, blog, or LMS. It's free, open source, and works everywhere.
toolCode.step1Desc: Click the "Copy Code" button above to copy the HTML snippet to your clipboard.
toolCode.step2Desc: Open your website editor, Notion page, WordPress, or LMS. Paste the code where you want the tool to appear.
toolCode.step3Desc: The tool will load automatically. Your visitors can use it right away ‚Äî no setup needed.
toolCode.previewDesc: This is exactly what it will look like on your website:
toolCode.attributionDesc: This embed code is completely free. The small attribution links at the bottom of the tool must remain in place ‚Äî that's how we keep this project free for everyone.
toolCode.videoComingSoon: Video tutorial coming soon! We'll walk you through the entire process step by step.
toolCode.githubDesc: Want to see how this tool is built? Explore the full source code, suggest improvements, or contribute.
toolCode.customizeTitle: Want to customize colors and fonts?
toolCode.customizeDesc: Use our advanced embed customizer to match the tool to your website's design.
toolCode.moreToolsDesc: All our tools are free and embeddable. Add any of them to your website.
toolCode.moreContentDesc: All our resources are free and embeddable. Add any of them to your website.
toolCode.metaDescTemplate: Get free, embeddable {toolName} HTML code for your website. Copy the code, paste it in, and you're done. Open source, works on any website, WordPress, Notion, or LMS.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Yes, completely free. You can embed it on any website, blog, LMS, or Notion page at no cost. We just ask that you keep the small attribution links at the bottom.
faq.q2: How do I add the {toolName} to my website?
faq.a2: Copy the HTML code from above and paste it into your website's HTML editor. It works on WordPress, Wix, Squarespace, Google Sites, Notion, Moodle, Canvas, and any platform that supports HTML embeds.
faq.q3: Can I customize how the {toolName} looks?
faq.a3: Yes! We offer an advanced customizer where you can change colors, fonts, and more to match your website's design. Click the "Open Embed Customizer" link above.
faq.q4: Do I need to keep the attribution links?
faq.a4: Yes. The attribution links are required under our open-source license. They help us keep this tool free for everyone. Removing them is not permitted.
faq.q5: Does it work on mobile devices?
faq.a5: Yes. The embedded tool is fully responsive and works on all screen sizes ‚Äî desktop, tablet, and mobile.
